results.title: October: 10 Days that Shook the World
results.brief_description: A brilliant construction of the momentous events of 1917, when revolutionary soldiers, sailors and factory workers overthrew the provisional Government of Russia, bringing Lenin and the Bolsheviks to power. Made by Sergei Eisenstein just ten years after the revolution. The vitality of his imagination, the symbols and metaphors with which he illuminates history, the fantastic spectacle, the sheer erudition have survived six decades undiminished.

results.title: October sky
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Larry Franco, Charles Gordon and Joe Johnston
results.brief_description: NASA engineer Homer J. Hickman, Jr’s autobiography provided the basis for this drama about a teenager coming of age at the dawn of the space race. In 1957, Homer Hickman (Jake Gyllenhaal) is a high school student in Coalwood, West Virginia, where coal mining is the only career path open to young people in the town. When news of the launch of the Soviet spaceship Sputnik breaks, most of the townsfolk react with fear or disgust, not Homer who is instantly fascinated and becomes obsessed with jet and rocket design. With the help of his three friends and teacher (Laura Dern), Homer sets out to build his own rocket. Despite his father’s (Chris Cooper) disapproval, a limited education and a series of misfires that threaten to flatten his dreams and the town, Homer overcomes the odds to realise his dreams. This is a story that mixes the drama of traditional family conflicts with a nostalgic glimpse of life in mid-50s America, as well as providing a look at the earliest days of our journey into space. Based on the book “Rocket boys” by Homer J. Hickman, Jr.

results.title: Oceans of science
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Bairstow, Bane Jovanovic, Douglas Kiefer and Jean-Pierre Lachapelle
results.brief_description: Shows what fisheries science is doing, both afloat and ashore, to ensure that life survives in the seas and inland waters. Projects on Canada’s three sea coasts and in many inland waters illustrate the vital and intriguing research directed towards restoring and protecting marine life. The film is encouraging evidence that old abuses of the great provider can be corrected and safeguards established.

results.title: Oceanography at work
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films, Ocean Science and Engineering and Willard Bascom
results.brief_description: Shows scientific methods of diamond prospecting under the sea. Geologists on the “Xhosa” use seismic surveys co-ordinated with land based radar beacons to map the ocean floor. The divers using underwater television probe for rock samples. Another ship, the “Rock-eater”, caps the search by drilling into a charted gravel deposit to bring diamonds from under the sea.

results.title: Ocean oddities
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions, Australian Educational Films and Noel Monkman
results.brief_description: The coral structure of the Great Barrier Reef provides protection for a number of creatures such as the stone-fish, the giant mantis shrimp,the crown of thorns seastar, the black beche-de-mer and the green turtle.

results.title: Ocean liners
results.brief_description: Brief but remarkable thorough document of the life of an ocean liner. Presents footage of ship construction in the shipyards and launching of the ship. Then goes into a description, using animated cross-sections, of the layout - cargo holds, fuel tanks, crew quarters, passenger quarters. Shows inspection of the crew prior to departure, life on board and the liner arriving at its destination.

results.title: Ocean challengers
results.creator_credit: Soundsense Film Productions, Brian Morris and David Perry
results.brief_description: Traces the epic voyage of the First fleet and contrasts it with the journey of group of adolescents who were prize-winners in an essay competition about the First Fleet. The students sailed from North Queensland to Sydney Harbour as crew members of a schooner.

results.title: Ocean Boulevard
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Sonia Humphrey and Rachael Ryan
results.brief_description: This drama follows a group of young people as they meet and interact. The group consists of two young army privates, two single girls and a girl already in a relationship. Through their interaction the film looks at issues such as self-worth, self-esteem, personal values, sexual identity and the way relationships are viewed.

results.title: Ocean's eleven
results.creator_credit: Dorchester, Warner Bros Pictures and Lewis Milestone
results.brief_description: Danny Ocean (Frank Sinatra) gathers together a group of ex-army buddies for an ambitious heist - the robbery of several casinos on New Year’s eve. His gang include playboy Jimmy (Peter Lawler), lounge lizard Sam (Dean Martin) and garbage man Josh (Sammy Davis Jnr) among others. At the time of production these very actors made up the crew known as the Rat Pack. Led by Sinatra, the Rat Pack were infamous for their carousing, womanising, drinking, entertaining and swinging image and in this film they do not stray far from their real life personas. “Ocean’s eleven” is not a film that treats the heist genre seriously in that it lacks any real tension of great films of that type. Rather, the film’s joys are derived from its 1960s aesthetic, the machinations of the sartorial Rat Pack at play, and the musical numbers courtesy of Davis and Martin. Also stars: Angie Dickinson , Cesar Romero, Shirley MacLaine, Joey Bishop and Red Skelton.
